Adho Mukha Svanasana: A foundational yoga pose that strengthens the arms and legs while stretching the spine.
Adho Mukha Vrksasana: An inversion that builds strength in the shoulders and core while improving balance.
Anjaneyasana: Opens the hips, stretches the thighs, and improves flexibility in the hip flexors.
Ardha Chandrasana: Develops balance and stability, strengthens the legs, and stretches the sides of the body.
Ardha Pincha Mayurasana: Prepares the body for more advanced inversions, strengthening the arms and shoulders.
Ashta Chandrasana: Combines strength and balance, opening the chest and improving flexibility.
Baddha Konasana: Opens the hips, improves flexibility, and stimulates the reproductive organs.
Bakasana: Arm balance that strengthens the wrists, arms, and abdominal muscles.
Balasana: Restorative pose that helps release tension in the back, neck, and shoulders.
Bitilasana: A gentle spinal warm-up that improves flexibility and coordination.
Dhanurasana: Backbend that strengthens the back muscles and improves posture.
Halasana: Stretches the spine, shoulders, and hamstrings, and stimulates the abdominal organs.
Hanumanasana: Deep stretch for the hamstrings and hip flexors, improving flexibility.
Malasana: Strengthens the lower back, ankles, and tones the abdominal muscles.
Marjaryasana: A gentle stretch for the back and neck, promoting flexibility and spinal mobility.
Padmasana: Promotes flexibility in the hips and knees, and encourages good posture.
Phalakasana: Strengthens the core muscles, arms, and wrists.
Pincha Mayurasana: Inversion that strengthens the shoulders, arms, and core.
Salamba Bhujangasana: Mild backbend that helps improve posture and strengthen the spine.
Ustrasana: Backbend that stretches the front of the body, opening the chest and hips.
Uttanasana: Stretches the hamstrings and spine, releasing tension.
Utthita Hasta Padangusthasana: Improves balance and flexibility, especially in the hamstrings.
Vasisthasana: Strengthens the arms, core, and legs while improving balance.
Vrksasana: Strengthens the legs, improves balance, and promotes focus and concentration.
